title: Great mid range Hotel -
text:
After reading revues the day before travelling, I was very concerned about the hotel BUT we loved it.
It was all paid for before going, so was pleasantly surprised when I had no additional charges when we checked out (as lots of previous revues had complained of being charged $30 per night for extras).
Yes the room was small (but as expected in New York) but you only use it as a base, I have stayed in other hotels there and had no bigger room. It was very clean, with room under the bed for luggage, there was even a hairdryer and iron, along with a safe and fridge. Pity there was no kettle, but I had already read this so we took our own.
All the staff we came across were friendly, helpful and knowledgable (especially the Doormen)
The drinks in the Bar were dear but only about the same as decent restaurant prices. Also people were complaining that the hotel and rooms were dark, yes they were but that just added to the ambience and you can turn the lights on in your room and move them for more light. The windows were hard to open but it makes a change to find a Hotel where you can open the window and don't have to rely on the air con.
We would certainly stay here again and would recommend it to others.
